org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.plate

Class PlatePopulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.plate.PlatePopulator

  • public final class PlatePopulator
extends Object
    PlatePopulator is a way to abstract away how a plate is to be populated. All the logic on what the next well to fill is encapsulated in this class so callers of this class don't need to worry about the business logic.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlatePopulator

        public PlatePopulator(Well.IndexOrder indexOrder,
                      PlateFormat format)
        Create a new PlatePopulator.
        Parameters:
        indexOrder - the order that the wells should get populated.
        format - the PlateFormat of the plate(s) to be populated.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any arguments are null.

    • Method Detail

      • isUnused

        public boolean isUnused(Well well)
        Is the given well used on this plate already.
        Parameters:
        well - the well to check.
        Returns:
        true if the well has been used; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if well is null.

      • use

        public void use(Well well)
        Mark the given well as being used.
        Parameters:
        well - the well to mark as being used.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if well is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the well has already been used.

      • getNumberOfUnusedWells

        public int getNumberOfUnusedWells()

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Is this plate finished or does this plate no longer have any unused wells on it.
        Returns:
        true if the plate is finished or has used up all its wells; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        use(Well), finishedPlate()

      • nextUnusedWell

        public Well nextUnusedWell()
        Get the next unused well based on the IndexOrder. WARNING: calling this method does not mark the well as used, you must also call use(Well).
        Returns:
        the new unused well, will never be null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the plate is full.
        See Also:
        use(Well)

      • finishedPlate

        public void finishedPlate()
        Mark the current plate as finished. Once a plate is marked as finished, it is considered full.

      • newPlate

        public void newPlate()
        Mark the current plate as finished and begin a using a new empty plate.
